name: Jason
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
路
3 weeks ago
,
路
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Completely worth it for the comfortable REAL beds, linens, blankets and pillows. Hands down the most comfortable beds - BOTH - I've come across using Air BnBs in over 5 years.
Location is great, had no idea that Gallo Blanco was open again which I hadn't dined at since they were at the Clarendon - so that was a great surprise and within walking distance. Amazing how the neighborhood has evolved over the past 20 years - for the better.
Private driveway parking was nice. The kitchen has everything, if I needed an extended stay, I wouldn't hesitate to book this place for a week as the kitchen will have everything you'll need, lots of condiments, spices, odds and ends too.
The air conditioning was ice cold and the ceiling fans were powerful, you NEED this during Phoenix summers. Any complaints I might have had are simply nit pics and not worth posting compared to the overall quality I experienced.

review_text: The location, house and decor were lovely and what we needed. My complaints are that the outside gate doesnt stay latched/closed (no communication about this) so my dog got out and we had a very stressful moment, luckily she came right back. Also the pool was really dirty so I only felt comfortable sticking my feet in. Not a fault of the owners, but the neighbors had a crazy loud party until 2 am (we even called the cops) so we got no sleep on our last night. Was disappointed that I got no response from the host when I messaged them these issues.

review_text: The house was in a great location. Only 10 minutes from downtown Phoenix, 20 minutes to Scottsdale, and 20 minutes to Tempe. It was nice staying in a home just a bit outside of the city so not to deal with any city traffic. The first thing we noticed when walking in were all the details. We loved the aesthetic of the cactus house and all the decor inside. We especially loved the bi帽ho board and it was our first time playing this game. We had so much fun playing once we got home we had to order our own. If I ever visit Phoenix again I would definitely stay at Dan and Frans. Not to mention all their dog friendly additives like the treats, bowls, and poop bags. Made us wish we brought our dogs.

October 2023
We really enjoyed our stay at the Cactus Cottage... The kitchen was pretty well stocked with basic items such as seasonings, oil, pots, pans, and utensils. The beds were comfortable. However, the pillows could have been a little bit more firm. The temperature in the home maintained a comfortable temperature. there were a couple of cobwebs we cleaned by the table in the kitchen, but maybe it was there for  vibes. Our grandson really enjoyed the tank pool. The neighborhood was walkable. We walked to the Welcome Diner for breakfast and walked over to Xanadu for coffee.. We even ventured over to Roosevelt Row... And even met a neighbor near to the property...

review_text: The stay at Dan and Frans went well until our last night when we went to enter the home and the door keypad had lost power and wouldnt unlock. I had tried contacting Dan and Fran that night but it was late and ultimately we had to get a hotel room for the night. In the morning we eventually made it into the Airbnb after some minor miscommunication with the lock box codes. That morning we checked out and I got an apology from Dan and Fran. They offered to compensate for the last night but I asked for them to compensate for the hotel room instead and I would just pay the total rental charge amount. They refused and only offered me compensation for the one night stay and some of the cleaning fee. The place was nice but after this Id recommend staying elsewhere to avoid any inconvenience.

Rating, 3 stars
,
路
December 2022
,
路
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I have to be honest because I would love to know things before I stay somewhere. The place was very nice and clean. Dan was great with communicating and coming to the house to try and make things right. That being said my stay was not comfortable at all. I checked out a day before my checkout date because we weee so uncomfortable. First thing, my husband and I got bit up my mosquitoes, we killed like 4 of them. We did bring this issue up with Dan and he said the house hasnt had any issues with them and Phoenix was prone to mosquitoes. I am in Town for business at least 2 weeks out of the month and never had any issues with mosquitoes. We just dealt with them. Second thing was the shower. The water does not get hot in the shower at all! You will get barely warm at best. All sinks get super hot. This was a deal breaker for me. I did message Dan and he came over and turned up the water heater, but when we showered that night it was literally no difference. I ended up sick taking cold showers. The night before we left I boiled hot water and took a bath just to get some kind of warmth. I felt like this was not real, but it was happening because I had no choice. I tried to thug it out, and I did for the most part but we just couldnt take it anymore. If you are ok with cold showers and barely warm showers this place is perfect! No other complaints at all. Beautiful place, but was just so uncomfortable.

We recommend this place to anyone and would happily stay again.

Stayed one night
review_text: Really the Platonic Ideal of the AirBnB. In the heat and clutter of a big dusty city, here is a minimalist clean white space with everything we needed and nothing we didn't need. My sister and her husband had one bedroom & bath, my wife & I took the other. We're all kind of fussy & picky people. But we were stoked! We had our own private spaces plus a roomy common space to share. Well-stocked kitchen, private tiny yard with a fruiting lemon tree, silent neighborhood, walked to the grocery store, to a gorgeous park surrounding the Heard Museum, to the Vietnamese restaurant across the street from the Thai restaurant. We even liked the crazy cat guy down the street: cats looked healthy, and he was pleasant to us. Highest possible recommendation.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Our stay at the property was quite pleasant overall, but there were a few areas that could be improved. The space was trendy and well-furnished, albeit a bit smaller than anticipated. While the neighborhood was peaceful, the surrounding scenery wasn't particularly remarkable. A notable issue we encountered was the presence of dog hair throughout the accommodation. Unfortunately, my wife is allergic to dog hair, and this significantly impacted her comfort and health during our stay. Despite our efforts to clean up, she was unwell for most of our visit. Additionally, having only one TV for all guests proved to be a bit inconvenient. In our experience with short-term rentals, multiple TVs are standard, and it would be a beneficial upgrade for future guests. We suggest that the owners consider addressing these points to enhance the experience for subsequent visitors.

review_text: Lisa and Waynes place was very cute and a perfect location. The neighborhood was cute and we felt safe during our stay. The beds were comfortable. The Nespresso machine was a great touch. The bathrooms had soap, shampoo and conditioner as well as a small hair dryer. The only thing we didnt care for was the shower design with only half glass. It looks cool, but no matter how careful you are water gets on the floor. Also, because the house is older and has beautiful wood flooring it creaks when you walk, only an issue if you are a light sleeper and someone else gets up. Otherwise great stay. During our stay the smoke detector started chirping due to a low battery in the morning. Lisa and Wayne were very fast to fix the issue and respond. It was fixed by the time we returned after our outing. Great stay.

It happened to be within walking distance of at least 4 vegan/vegetarian eateries, which was a major plus for me! It was very clean and appealing. We loved the kitchen (although didn't get a chance to use it), and thought it very convenient that a washer and dryer were available. This house is nicely renovated/decorated (although not vegan, as you can probably tell by the photos) and felt cozy and welcoming. It was very clean and appealing. The showers had hot water and good water pressure, and there were clean/green personal care products available. Check in and checkout were effortless. I would love to stay here again if I am in the area.

For other like my husband who aren't used to Phoenix heat may need to reconsider. Overall, I like this place. For a 2BR2B, it's a reasonable price. We stayed for two nights. I would stay here again, but asking my husband to use that squeegee as requested in the household rule is pain. Maybe if they change that request.

My only regret was not being able to enjoy the casita as much as I would have liked as I was out and about for working meetings most of the time. Highly recommend!

Stayed with kids
review_text: This Peoria casita was the ideal location for our family of four! The casita is located on in a quiet residential area, but only minutes from the grocery store, restaurants, and some local shops. The home was pristine; felt like new and very clean. It looked exactly like the photos online. We loved having a full kitchen and separate living space and even made use of the small yard with the kids during the day. Loved having laundry onsite as well! While the living room is certainly large enough for a pull-out if the owners ever consider it, the blow-up mattress was king-sized, comfortable and easy to use. We could have used some extra pillows since some of us sleep with more than one, and a few extra towels/wash cloths. We feel so lucky to have found this incredible house and hope to be back on our next visit!

review_text: I went out of state for a funeral and when I was looking for an air bnb the only thing I was concerned about was how far it would be from the cemetery. This listing was highly rated and I was very surprised with how spacious it was once I arrived. It was very private and extremely clean. They had things like cotton swabs and cotton balls available which I thought was a nice touch to make us feel at home. The washer and dryer was in the room and I thought it would be loud but I just closed the door to the linen closet and I was able to sleep peacefully at night while doing my laundry. I highly recommend this air bnb. When I come back to Arizona I will book here again. The hosts were extremely helpful and kept checking in to make sure I was enjoying my stay. Considering the circumstances, I really did enjoy my time here.

name: Kevin
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
路
December 2023
,
路
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The abundance of 5 star reviews tells you all you need to knowBook it! And add an extra day because you will not want to leave. If peace can be found in a city, its right here, above it all. The view is sooo picturesque that it inspired us to be early birds for those few days we were here just to get the soonest glimpse. With a cup of tea in hand, we woke up everyday to a magnificent sunrise peaking out from behind the mountains. It was simply incredible. Though there was peace to be had, you could also find the city life not too far of a drive. The home was clean, the wifi strong, the bed/pillows comfortable, and the kitchen was well stocked. So if youre looking for serenity with the option to go out for a good time, book here. If Im ever back in Phoenix, I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again. I hope that you who are reading this gets to experience it for yourself. Its special. Thank you Carla for sharing your home with us.

The bed was very comfortable and the hot tub was the icing on the cake. Best Airbnb stay yet.

Stayed one night
review_text:
There are some Airbnbs that you stay in because you need a clean place to stay
Then there are other Airbnbs that you stay in because you want a break from the monotony of everyday life and have an extraordinary experience of being alive.
Carlas place would definitely be the ladder.
To say this place is magical would be an understatement
The experience of having a glass of wine while overlooking the aerial views of Phoenix as the sun sets is something you and your significant other will never forget.
The pictures dont deliver on half of what youll feel when you stay here. Its extremely clean, modern and well thought out.
Youll be impressed with the fine details that have be laid out in every corner of the home.
If you want the experience or being alive dont look at any other properties, this is the one youve been looking for.
And because youve read this entire review this is the sign that you need to book now before someone else does.
Enjoy

review_text:
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!
Incredible view of the whole valley, with beautiful sunrises and sunsets! The Nest is such a high-end and trendy place, but yet completely comfortable like home. The furnishing are hi-end, and the decorations are unique, creative and oh so trendy! Loved the kitchen ceiling light, the keg light over the sink, and the shelving unit under the bedroom TV is so swank!
The couch is extremely comfortable and reclines on both ends. Its a toss up as to whether the couch or the bed is more comfortable!
We had breakfast on the deck every morning and enjoyed relaxing in the amazing jacuzzi in the evenings.
Carla is an exceptional host and responded immediately to all of our inquiries!! Her pride in The Nest is evident in the way she communicates with you! 5+ Star host all the way!
We look forward to returning to The Nest the next time we are in the Phoenix area! This is our #1 place to stay now! Loved it!

The views are breathtaking, and you feel like you are in your own private castle. the hot tub is especially fantastic. The bed was one, if not the, most comfortable I've ever slept in, to the point where I actually asked where she bought it! I have recommended this home to many friends already. It is the absolute perfect escape for a couple or, like me, a solo (and successful) reset mission. Thank you, Carla! My return trip is in the works!

review_text: If I could I would give this place at least 6, maybe 7 stars. I am a local to Phoenix but wanted to find a staycation spot for my girlfriend's birthday that was private and had great views. I for sure made the right decision with this place. You can see every corner of the valley from the "Nest", sunrise and sunset are incredible!! If you are on the fence with a few places just book this one, you won't have any regrets. You'll mostly be looking at the great exterior views but inside is beautifully designed and has your convivence in mind. Carla was an amazing host and went above and beyond. It's a little pricey but in the end you will make priceless memories, it's worth it, just do it!

It felt tranquil and secluded enough while also being easily accessible to delivery drivers. Would be perfect for long term stays for sure. I booked this place because I read another review that read something like if youre on the fence about staying here just do it, and after my stay I agree completely. Just book it.
Tip: The outdoor shower is nestled among the rocks, totally private, and has a warm setting.

name: Kelly

Rating, 4 stars
,
路
January 2023
,
路
Stayed one night
review_text: Patty's guest studio is well-appointed, clean, cozy, and an architectural marvel. I loved the concrete and number of windows, as well as a fully stocked kitchen. The kitchen had goodies like granola bars, Cheezits, half and half, and gratefully, almond milk. Great lighting and aesthetics, as well as a nice hot shower and well-appointed bathroom with plush towels, shampoo, conditioner, salt scrub, blow-dryer. I didn't watch TV or use wi-fi, but it's all there. The bed was firm but not too firm and the linens clean and crisp. The only downsides, and this probably only applies to me and a few would-be guests, is that the pillows were too soft and the heater wasn't really strong enough to heat up the place. I was there during a rare cold and rainy day, but I can see the place being the perfect pad during the warmer months. I'm sure that in summer, the outdoor shower is a must-use! Overall, great value; Patty was extremely responsive with communication. I'd stay in summer in a heat-beat!

I had enough space to lay out all my gear, pack accordingly, and wash up some dirty clothes after trekking through Aravaipa Canyon for 3.5 days. The bed does sit a little low to the ground, and its a little stiff. There is also some road noise that can be heard (cars passing, train horns, sirens etc.) but it didnt bother me too much. Just thought it was worth the mention. I would definitely stay here again!

name: Aaron
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
路
March 2023
,
路
Stayed one night
review_text:
We, my girlfriend and I, had a wonderful stay. The casita is beautiful with a modern feel that made you feel at home from the moment you walked in.
All the amenities and extra touches you'd want were right there for you to use and enjoy. There was a great coffee maker (with plenty of coffee), a good size fridge, and a microwave. In the closet was extras like disposable plates, paper towels, and forks! The bathroom was great! Plenty of space for toiletries and the shower was nice and big! Water pressure was great and we had no problems getting hot water. There's even a hairdryer in the magic closet if you need it!
Lastly, there is a ceiling fan and a/c if you need air flow or to cool things down and again in the magic closet, a small space heater if you need warming up on those unexpected chilly days.
Our only suggestion is to upgrade the mattress to make the stay that much more perfect. Don't get us wrong, we'd happily stay here again in the future and would recommend to everyone!

review_text:
The Casita was exactly what I needed for a couple of nights before embarking on a backpacking trip into the Superstition Mountains with REI. Its easy to catch ride-share from here, so not having a car was no problem.
The place was very tidy and clean. Its a charming little place with enough open floor space to do some yoga and spread out my gear before I loaded my pack for my backpacking adventure. Also, lots of towels available.
Tasha and Brandon responded quickly to my questions and messages. They were so quiet it felt like I was completely alone. If youre looking for a private, cozy place to stay, this is the place. Id definitely stay here again.
CAUTION: I took 2 Uber rides to the Casita and both times their drivers stopped a block over from the actual spot. Im not sure what the error is in Ubers system, but the pin gets dropped a street behind the actual home.

路

,
路
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Tasha and Brandon have created a really wonderful space for guests! They thought of every detail and made their casita welcoming, warm and cozy. When I arrived they had an essential oil diffuser running which smelled lovely! Plenty of towels and supplies, popcorn and coffee. The bed was comfortable and though it was chilly during my visit, I didnt really need to use the heater much. The water in the bathroom gets very hot and shower has decent water pressure. I also appreciated the lighting options inside. I didnt use the smart TV but it looked easy enough to navigate. Having a desk was great for some remote work during my stay, and the internet was reliable and easy to connect to. I have stayed in a lot of airbnbs over the years and really rank this one high on the top of my list. If Im back in Phoenix I would happily book again! If you need a cozy spot not far from resort conference centers, I highly recommend Tasha and Brandons delightful casita! Thanks for a great stay.

Rating, 4 stars
,
路
5 days ago
,
路
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I recently stayed at Donna's Airbnb for a couple of nights. While the early check-in process was smooth and the place itself is great, well-stocked, and has comfortable beds and furniture, plus a fantastic backyard and pool, I had an unfortunate experience with the grilling amenities.
There were two propane grills, and neither one was operable. I messaged the host to notify her about my findings, and this is when she mentioned that it was stated in the listing to "BBQ GRILL provided, just bring the propane" along with a story as to why. This was a first for me, as I've never been told to bring my own propane for a grill at an Airbnb, not in all my years and hundreds of rentals. For this reason, I wont choose this property next time Im in the area.
Despite this hiccup, the rest of the stay was enjoyable, and the property is well-maintained. The home is beautiful and well-furnished, and the pool is wonderful and warm.

The pool area is very nice, and the living area is a great space to hang out and enjoy each other's company. Huge televisions in every bedroom.
All in all, we had a lovely stay, and I would recommend this property. Thank you for helping to make my daughter's graduation a special and memorable experience.

review_text:
Highly HIGHLY recommend this beautiful home! Probably one of the top, if not THE top, Airbnb I've ever stayed at. It had everything our group of 5 needed, and could definitely accommodate a larger group per what the listing describes.
The house was clean, very spacious, beautifully decorated, and well equipped with everything needed in the kitchen. The pool was super clean and very refreshing. We spent peaceful mornings outside having coffee, and the patio area was great for hanging out. On top of a beautiful home, Dohl was amazing, super friendly, and quick to reply to messages.
Extra kudos for all the special touches. There were towels for the pool, a fresh bag of ice in the freezer, fully stocked coffee area with coffee pods/syrup, and the individually packaged condiments in the fridge.
We feel SO grateful to have spent our time in Phoenix at this beauty, and hope to stay again! Thank you Dohl for being an outstanding host!

Only a quick 15 minute Uber ride to both the airport and downtown Phoenix. We went when it was 115 degrees everyday and the house stayed nice and cool which we needed!
Dohl was very responsive and very easy to work with. Highly recommend!

This felt like a hotel suite honestly. The backyard had great touches with beautiful trees and a gazebo and loungers.
Dohl was very responsive and helpful.
This was my first time staying at an Airbnb and I was shocked at how GREAT it went. I read the review before mine and my brother said it was a fake review. Now leaving this review I understand why.
Take this place if it's available, you 100% will be happy you did.

review_text: This is our 2nd stay with Nate and Steven, but in one of the studios instead of the house. It was great to be back! The Butterfly Studio was a perfect size and as usual had everything we needed and even the things we didn't know we needed like snacks and a huge coffee variety! Beds and linens are so comfortable! We lucked out with mild weather for late April and were able to play cards and have wine outside. The shared yard/resort area makes this a little get away even if it was move out week for college. There are other people in the house and Garden Studio, but there is plenty of privacy and the outdoor spaces have enough room where we can do our own thing--like a hotel patio. We love it here, it is always the first place we check when we come to visit GCU--but they book fast! Thanks for a great visit.

review_text:
Fantastic Stay!
I needed a place to stay after our AC went out and had spent the day overheated & stressed ( me and my two dogs). I booked the Airbnb in a hurry and was disheveled  to be honest didnt read the instructions super thoroughly. When I arrived, after 10 pm, the hosts were super responsive and helpful in helping me get in.
There was a slight issue during check in and they immediately upgraded me to a larger Airbnb on property. That was really kind and impressive.
The neighborhood is really nice & quiet. Central Phoenix can be hit or miss on the areas in some pockets, but this spot is very quiet and safe. Youll be very close to plenty of local favorite dining options like Joyride Taco, First draft book bar and our personal fave, Clever Koi. The house is eclectic, artistic and well designed with lots of amenities like surround sound, outdoor seating, super soft sheets & a spa like shower & soaking tub.
10/10 and cant wait to return under better circumstances!

April 2022
,
路
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Phoenix is a huge city and I don't claim to know much about its various districts and suburbs but we did enjoy our time in the area surrounding this Airbnb. Within walking distance is a gourmet grocery store and a few restaurants, I was surprised to find a reasonable sushi experience that didn't involve driving across town! We didn't take the public transit but I did notice that it would be super easy to do so from Nate & Steven's house. The space itself is great, these guys really put a lot of effort into the communal areas and we enjoyed relaxing out there under the ample shade. Laundry machines were modern and cleaned/dried without issue.
The studio space was fine, the key elements were great: comfy king bed, well-functioning air conditioning, and a fancy shower experience. Bathroom and kitchen areas were clean, kitchen had everything we needed to prepare meals. The only downside to mention was that the floors were sticky and dirty in spots but this has to be the fault of the cleaners (I've messaged the hosts to make sure they address this) -- easily rectifiable. Other than that we had a restful time here and feel recharged to continue our adventures!

review_text:
We had the good fortune of booking this Airbnb last minute for our big family gathering, and we couldnt be more pleased with our experience. First off, wed like to extend our deepest gratitude to our hosts for accommodating us on such short notice, especially considering our large group and pets. Their flexibility and hospitality truly saved our trip.
Upon arrival, we were immediately impressed with the cleanliness of the house. Its not often you find a place that looks just as pristine in person as it does in photos, but this house did not disappoint. Every room was spotlessly clean, which made for a very comfortable and welcoming stay.
The kitchen deserves a special mention. It was fully stocked with all the essentials we could possibly need  and then some. Cooking for a large family can be a daunting task, but the availability of various utensils, pots, pans, and appliances made meal preparation not only easy but enjoyable. It felt like a home away from home!

This was the perfect spot for my wife mom 3 kids and I to rest our heads as we traveled home. Suzette thought of everything that a traveling family would need. Even had a high chair and pack n play making it easy for us to use for our baby.
The live plants were a nice touch. My wife kept talking about how typically people use fake plants. Shes a green thumb and it just made her night.
She had snacks in the fridge for the kiddos. Milk & juice too.
We were able to pull right up into the garage and unload the car. Which made for a perfect load up and go the next morning as it was raining and we didnt have to worry about getting wet. That was convenient.
If we are ever back traveling through we will check to see if her place is available again. Thanks for a cozy nights stay.

The towels and linens were the same quality found in nice hotels. It is in a quiet neighborhood and is close to so many amenities. Suzette was very accommodating ( a had a few requests for my disabled son ). We would definitely stay here again if we visit the Phoenix area in the future. Thank you again Suzette for hosting us!

review_text: If I could give Suzette and her wonderful Windchime House 10 stars I would! First of all, she is hands down the most thoughtful AirBnb host I've ever encountered. Not only was the house spotless (and absolutely adorable), but there were SO many sweet personal touches that she added. From a handwritten card welcoming us to her home, to a fruit bowl on the dining table, a bowl of snacks on the counter, a bowl of candies on the side board, to travel size toothpaste and shampoo/conditioner in the bathrooms. The home is PERFECT for dog owners. There was a super comfy dog bed in the living space, and even a dog bowl set for food and water. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. The A/C was on point. The kitchen was nicely appointed for anyone who wants to cook a full meal. The house is set up with a multitude of free streaming apps. They have a built-in bookcase full of (good) books and an even better selection of games. The outdoor space offers multiple choices to sit and relax. 10 STARS!

review_text: We absolutely loved staying at Suzettes airbnb. It is impeccably clean, the sheets and towels are so soft and plush, and we had plenty of space to make ourselves at home. We were traveling with our two large dogs, and with them comes a lot of stuff, and we had plenty of space for all of it. But most importantly, our dogs felt at home with a great yard with shade and shrubs and smells, a basket of dog toys and dog bowls, and nice cool tile floors inside. Suzette goes above and beyond to make you feel at home with a welcome note and snacks and drinks in the fridge, including fresh fruit. All these touches make such a difference. I got sick on our last day and was able to book an extra day to rest before hitting the road - it helped that I was in a place as comfortable as Suzettes. We are very grateful for her hospitality, and look forward to staying here again.

review_text: I consider myself an Airbnb connoisseur (as a former Airbnb host and frequent user) and I think that this is among the best Airbnbs I've stayed in. There were many thoughtful touches, high quality linens, beverages, fruit, and snacks, fully stocked kitchen, outlets on the nightstands for charging, an empty two car garage, and a note from the host upon our arrival. Although we didn't have kids or dogs with us, we noted that the listing had a dog bed, bowls, bags, and a pack n play with mattress and fitted sheet, high chair, and a variety of books and games. I was also impressed by the different products in the house, and the information sheets/QR codes about them. Essentially, it has everything that you would want in a place you are traveling, but also many personal touches, including plants. Communication with Suzette was easy. This place would be great for a long term stay. I would definitely stay here again if I'm in this part of Phoenix in the future.

First of all, let me start off by saying that Suzette is a great host. Very attentive, communicative and respectful!
The place is wonderful! Its a very beautiful house, clean and spotless, spacious, comfy and great vibes. The beds are very comfortable, towels and linens are top quality, the shower is great, overall a great experience staying at Suzettes home! I seriously recommend that you book this place, you wont regret it! Its a million times better than a hotel! Snacks provided are such a nice touch! And on top of that, access to the garage (2 car) is great, especially if youre on a road trip and want to store your car safely and away from the heat.
Do yourself a favor, and book this place. I will for sure come back some day, and will tell my friends and family about it!
